intro: Parosela leucosericea, commonly known as the white silky parosela, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
